intro: Polygala vulgaris lusus suberecta, commonly known as the upright milkwort, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, upright stems and small, greenish-white flowers clustered in racemes. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are usually hairy, and it thrives in well-drained soils in full sun. It is often found in rocky or sandy habitats and is valued for its ornamental appeal. The species is also noted for its ability to tolerate drought conditions once established.
